results.title: Visibility and protective clothing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycling”
Examines the problems many motorists have in seeing motorcyclists, due to poor visibility from cars. Demonstrates the importance of protective clothing, the selection of the correct helmet, footgear, and gloves. Some riders talk about their accidents and injuries they have received.

results.title: News digest [No. 9]
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and ABC
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Kyabram’s rodeo; 12,000 sea shells collected from the world’s beaches; Victoria’s first mobile water patrol equipped with a bar tender cruiser is launched at Sandringham; underwater enthusiasts collect relics from old steamers; movies on the move at the Myer Music Bowl shown by the State Film Centre on a 24 by 8 foot screen as part of the Moomba festivities.

results.title: Viewpoint on Sydney
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Sydney, New South Wales, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. It is seen as a big exciting city with many contrasts. Job opportunities are discussed as well as other advantages and disadvantages of living in Sydney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Viewpoint on Hobart
results.creator_credit: Barry Williams, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Hobart, Tasmania, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. This film expresses accounts of prejudice and discrimination as well as the advantages of living in Hobart. Also included are brief sequences showing varied aspects of life around the city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Williams, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Viewpoint on Brisbane
results.creator_credit: Barry Williams, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Brisbane, Queensland, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. Language presents more than a communication barrier to the new arrival. It is both a handicap at work and in impediment socially. Criticism is made of officials who do not advise migrants to learn English before landing in Australia. Also discusses the easy going life style of the Queenslanders.

results.title: Viewpoint on Adelaide
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Adelaide, South Australia, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. Becoming accustomed to Australia was the main problem of migrants in this film. The language barrier, strange customs and the long hours of work required to become established are discussed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Valley of the Yarra
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams and Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division
results.brief_description: Follows the Yarra River from its source in the mountains to the busy port where it joins Port Phillip Bay. Stresses the importance of the Yarra in the supply of water for Melbourne. Shows farmlands and towns, landscapes and scenery along the river as it goes through to Melbourne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maslyn Williams and Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division

results.title: The Valley is ours
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes, John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This classic documentary celebrates the variety of activities the Murray River and the surrounding district sustains: from agriculture to timber, fishing to mining, fruit picking to shipbuilding. There is a special focus on the optimistic spirit of the people of the region as they overcome problems of erosion, bushfire and drought and makes a plea for further development, arguing that at least another million people could find happy homes in this fertile territory.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Hawes, John Heyer and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The Unlucky country
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Denys Brown and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: South Vietnam, a developing country facing the process of improving standards of living, health and education, against a background of constant dissension and war - the dual objectives to win a war and develop a country. Discusses the role of Australian Task Forces in establishing security and providing aid for civil development. Shows the work of the three medical teams.

results.title: Facts
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
A change in working hours upsets the workers at a factory and Dixon, the Union delegate, is asked to report the change to the union office. In his report to the organiser, Dixon manages to bring in all sorts of irrelevancies but is very short on accurate information. This film manages to pinpoint an area of possible confusion if union delegates fail to get the facts straight.
